results.title: Bob and Caren and Ted and Janice
results.creator_credit: David Bowen, Charles Palmer and Parthenon Pictures
results.brief_description: A counseling film for high school students which shows four young people as they consider a vocational career as one way to meet today’s problems. The four characters are juxtaposed in a series of rapid switches back and forth as their individual problems are presented, developed and resolved. Cast: Doug Fulton, Sandra Aiena, Rodney Wallace and Kathleen Peveler. Original music by “Last Chance”.
results.title_for_label: Bob and Caren and Ted and Janice
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Bowen, Charles Palmer and Parthenon Pictures

results.title: The Blue ringed octopus
results.creator_credit: Wave Productions and Western Australia. Audio-Visual Education Branch
results.brief_description: Describes the venomous blue-ringed octopus, found in all coastal waters of Australia. If touched, this tiny creature’s rough skin causes abrasions through which a toxic and lethal poison enters the body, affects the nervous system, and paralyses the victim. There is no anti-venene, but the treatment is shown. No other credits available.

results.title: Blue mould of tobacco
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Recommended methods of controlling the Blue Mould disease which is a fungus living on tobacco plants. The disease is widespread in the Australian tobacco industry. Samples of infected plants; how it is spread; the use of benzol vapour as recommended by Research Officers; fertilizing the soil; irrigation by furrow and boom spray methods; helicopter and plane spraying; the work of the Research Laboratories which test suspected plants; and work towards breeding a blue mould resistant strain of tobacco.

results.title: The Blue men of Morocco
results.brief_description: The strange story of a mysterious nomadic desert tribe of Arabs almost unknown to the outside world. The religious customs and strange ways of life of these people whose skin acquires its colour from the dye in their clothing. Explains how the tribe earns a living and describes a camel trip over the Sahara Desert and across the Atlas mountains to the city of Marrakesh. No other credits available.

results.title: Blue like an orange
results.brief_description: Puppets of the Orient and the Occident are presented in this UNESCO contribution to understanding between East and West. Scenes of puppet plays in India, Japan, Singapore, Malaysia, Laos, Poland, Czechoslovakia and the United States today. The presentations illustrate the great variety of the traditions which have survived for thousands of years. Also includes archival footage of Jim Henson and “the muppets” including a very early Kermit.

results.title: Blue Ice
results.creator_credit: Phillip Garth Law, External Affairs and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A record of the 1954 Australian National Antarctic Research Expedition, which relieved the scientific stations at Macquarie and Heard Islands and established a new station at Mawson on MacRobertson Land in Australian Antarctic Territory. The film describes the expedition’s departure from Melbourne in December 1953 and follows its 12,000 mile journey through high seas and pack ice, providing an insight into daily life at the stations and the challenges presented by often-difficult conditions. There is stunning footage of towering icebergs and masses of penguins as well as aerial reconnaissance and surveillance.

results.title: Blue collar blues
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Four corners (Television program)”.
The film through interviews, discusses the problems of automation and the alternatives. The contrast is shown between a Ford factory where the assembly line was devised sixty years ago, the fastest car factory in the world - the General Motors plant in Ohio, the Volvo plant in Sweden, and an Avon factory in Sydney. No other credits available.
